Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment
of JOHN H. BANKS, III as a Member of the Board of Corrections.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which preconsidered on December 19, 2001, respectfully

REPORTS  

Pursuant to Section 626 of Chapter 25 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves and refers to the entire City Council for appointment of JOHN H. BANKS, III as a Member of the Board of Corrections, to serve for the remainder of a term which began on October 13, 1996 and will expire on October 12, 2002.


Res. No. 2188


RESOLUTION APPROVING AND REFERRING TO THE ENTIRE CITY COUNCIL FOR APPOINTMENT OF JOHN H. BANKS, III AS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF CORRECTIONS.

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 626 of Chapter 25 of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby appoints JOHN H. BANKS, III as a Member of the Board of Corrections, to serve for the remainder of a term which began on October 13, 1996 and will expire on October 12, 2002.
Items.MatterName: Preconsidered M 1347 - John H. Banks, III - Appointment, NYC Board of Corrections

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the reappointment by the Mayor of STANLEY K. SCHLEIN as a Member of the New York City Civil Service Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on December 11, 2001, respectfully

REPORTS
         	
Pursuant to Sections 31 and 812 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the reappointment of STANLEY K. SCHLEIN  (Democrat) as a Member of the New York City Civil Service Commission, to serve for the remainder of a six year term, which commenced on March 22, 1999 and will expire on March 21, 2005.

Res. No. 2187

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT OF STANLEY K. SCHLEIN
AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Sections 31 and 812 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment of STANLEY K. SCHLEIN (Democrat) as a Member of the New York City Civil Service Commission, to serve for the remainder of a six year term, which commenced on March 22, 1999 and will expire on March 21, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 1325 - Stanley K. Schlein,  Reappointment NYC Civil Service Commission

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of NOACH DEAR  as a Member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was preconsidered on December 19, 2001 respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of NOACH DEAR, as a Member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission for the remainder of a seven year term, which will expire on January 31, 2008

Res. No. 2191

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF NOACH DEAR, AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY TAXI AND LIMOUSINE COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of NOACH DEAR, as a Member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, for the remainder of a seven year term, which will expire on January 31, 2008.
Items.MatterName: Preconsidered M 1336 - Noach Dear, Appointment, Taxi & Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment
of JOHN H. BANKS, III as a Member of the Board of Corrections.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which preconsidered on December 19, 2001, respectfully

REPORTS  

Pursuant to Section 626 of Chapter 25 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves and refers to the entire City Council for appointment of JOHN H. BANKS, III as a Member of the Board of Corrections, to serve for the remainder of a term which began on October 13, 1996 and will expire on October 12, 2002.


Res. No. 2188


RESOLUTION APPROVING AND REFERRING TO THE ENTIRE CITY COUNCIL FOR APPOINTMENT OF JOHN H. BANKS, III AS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF CORRECTIONS.

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 626 of Chapter 25 of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby appoints JOHN H. BANKS, III as a Member of the Board of Corrections, to serve for the remainder of a term which began on October 13, 1996 and will expire on October 12, 2002.
Items.MatterName: Preconsidered M 1347 - John H. Banks, III - Appointment, NYC Board of Corrections

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the reappointment by the Mayor of STANLEY K. SCHLEIN as a Member of the New York City Civil Service Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on December 11, 2001, respectfully

REPORTS
         	
Pursuant to Sections 31 and 812 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the reappointment of STANLEY K. SCHLEIN  (Democrat) as a Member of the New York City Civil Service Commission, to serve for the remainder of a six year term, which commenced on March 22, 1999 and will expire on March 21, 2005.

Res. No. 2187

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT OF STANLEY K. SCHLEIN
AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Sections 31 and 812 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment of STANLEY K. SCHLEIN (Democrat) as a Member of the New York City Civil Service Commission, to serve for the remainder of a six year term, which commenced on March 22, 1999 and will expire on March 21, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 1325 - Stanley K. Schlein,  Reappointment NYC Civil Service Commission

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of NOACH DEAR  as a Member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was preconsidered on December 19, 2001 respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of NOACH DEAR, as a Member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission for the remainder of a seven year term, which will expire on January 31, 2008

Res. No. 2191

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF NOACH DEAR, AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY TAXI AND LIMOUSINE COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of NOACH DEAR, as a Member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, for the remainder of a seven year term, which will expire on January 31, 2008.
Items.MatterName: Preconsidered M 1336 - Noach Dear, Appointment, Taxi & Limousine Commission
